page.title: 15The River Side
page.content: The use of the river side has changed considerably in the last 20 years. Much of the South Denes bank has been occupied by firms connected with rig supplying and pipe and equipment stores. Oil platforms are built at Bollard Quay on the Gorleston side, by Norwell. Wimpey Marine store drilling muds, cement, bulk chemicals and are engaged in 24 hour helicopter coordination. A new customs house has been built by Darby's Hard on the west bank, the Hard still being used for small fishing vessels. Near the bottom of Baker St. is the lifeboat house with both a fast inshore dinghy and the main boat, the Barham. The ferry continues to operate regularly across the harbour from Ferry Hill to near the Birds Eye factory and carries many South Denes workers in the early morning and late afternoon.
